New Records: Wales faced their first penalty shootout in a major tournament qualification match.
The match ended goalless after 120 minutes, marking a milestone for Wales in a competitive setting.
Key Match Events: Ben Davies had a disallowed header in the first half.
Chris Mepham was sent off for a second booking late in the game.
The match went to extra time due to a goalless draw.
Poland won the penalty shootout 5-4, securing their place at Euro 2024.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales manager Rob Page emphasized the team's preparation and their belief in winning the match.
The absence of key players like Gareth Bale and Aaron Ramsey was noted as Wales relied on a young squad.
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page expressed disappointment but pride in the team's performance and future potential.
Wales captain Ben Davies highlighted the team's character and the emotional impact of the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was Wales' first time in a penalty shootout in a major tournament qualification.
Poland's perfect penalty shootout performance was a key factor in their victory.
Others: The match was held at Cardiff City Stadium with a pre-match rendition of the national anthem for Wales.
